@JOHNNY DEPP I was a victim of abuse, too.  My ex-husband was telling medical staff behind my back that I was jealous and vindictive.  At the end, he threatened me with a knife and strangled me.  When I reported his abuse, the medical staff wrote if off as me being vindictive.  I ended up with PTSD that was not diagnosed for over a year, so it became chronic and much more difficult to treat.  I've had PTSD for 7 years now and it's ruined my health and harmed my career.  I tell people, "I am Johnny Depp" because my ex-husband set me up and got out ahead of me so I would be believed when I came forward, the scam Amber pulled on you.  I've listened to the audios and I recognize the signs of an abuser.  I'm sorry she did this to you.  It's horrible.  I'm glad you are fighting her in court.  I feel like you are fighting for all of the victims, like me, who didn't get justice, whose abusers conned those meant to help us.  Thank you for doing this.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to talk openly about domestic violence and educate the world.  What you've done is so, so brave.  I am not a Depp-head, but I fully support you as a fellow victim of abuse.
